ref: 13744 sthála n. ʻ dry land ʼ TS., ʻ ground, place ʼ Mn., ʻ flat surface, roof ʼ Kālid., sthálā -- f. ʻ heap of earth ʼ TS., sthalī -- f. ʻ eminence, tableland ʼ MBh. [√sthal]

Pk. thala -- n. ʻ dry place, place ʼ, thalī -- f. ʻ dry place ʼ;
K. thal f. ʻ place ʼ, thüjü f. ʻ dry ground suitable for seed beds ʼ;
S. tharu m. ʻ desert, e
sp. that east of Sindh ʼ (whence tharī ʻ pertaining to the desert ʼ, tharjaṇu ʻ to be filled with sand ʼ);

P. thal m. ʻ sandy region, desert ʼ;
Ku. thal ʻ dry or firm ground, place, shrine ʼ, thali ʻ flat raised land ʼ;
N. thal ʻ place ʼ, thalo ʻ place where bullocks tread out rice ʼ, thali ʻ place where something is planted ʼ;
A. thal ʻ dry ground, flat ground, plain, place ʼ, thali ʻ dry place, field of crops ʼ;
B. thal ʻ flat surface, bottom, place ʼ;
Or. thaḷa ʻ ground, ford, place ʼ, thaḷi ʻ level field ʼ;
Mth. goṛthariā ʻ foot board of a bed ʼ; O
Aw. thala m. ʻ high dry land ʼ;
H. thal m. ʻ firm dry ground, ground, mound, den ʼ, thalī f. ʻ place ʼ; O
Marw. thala m. ʻ land ʼ, thalo m. ʻ earth ʼ, thalī f. ʻ doorstep ʼ;
G. thaḷ n. ʻ place, haunted spot ʼ;
M. thaḷ n. ʻ plantation, place, haunted spot ʼ, thaḷī f. ʻ plantation ʼ;
Si. tala -- ya, talā ʻ dry land, high ground, hill ʼ; --
